statements: UPDATE business_KPIs SET revenue = 15000, expenses = 10000 WHERE business_id = 101 AND date = '2022-01-15';
UPDATE business_KPIs SET expenses = 8000, profit = 7000 WHERE date = '2022-02-28' AND business_id = 102;
UPDATE business_KPIs SET expenses = expenses - 500, revenue = 1500 WHERE business_id = 101
UPDATE business_KPIs SET profit = (revenue - expenses) * 0.2, date = '2022-10-31' WHERE business_id = 102
UPDATE kpi_metrics SET calculation_formula = 'SUM(value1, value2)' WHERE metric_id = 1;
UPDATE kpi_results SET result = actual_value * 0.9, date = '2025-10-15' WHERE result_id = 3;
UPDATE kpi_metrics SET calculation_formula = 'SUM(actual_value * 0.5)' WHERE metric_id = 1;
UPDATE kpi_results SET result = actual_value * 0.9, actual_value = actual_value * 1.1 WHERE date = '2022-10-15' AND metric_id = 2;
UPDATE KPI_Customers SET city='New York', country='USA' WHERE customer_id=123;
UPDATE KPI_Sales SET product_name='New Product', sale_amount=500.50 WHERE sale_id=456;
UPDATE KPI_Customers SET city = 'New York', country = 'USA' WHERE customer_id = 101;
UPDATE KPI_Sales SET sale_amount = 1500.75, product_name = 'Smartphone' WHERE customer_id IN (SELECT customer_id FROM KPI_Customers WHERE city = 'Los Angeles');
UPDATE kpi_statistics SET kpi_value = 1500.25, time_period = '2023-01-15' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE kpi_parameters SET parameter_value = 0.85 WHERE parameter_name = 'Retention Rate';
UPDATE kpi_parameters SET parameter_value = 1500.35 WHERE kpi_name = 'Revenue' AND parameter_name = 'Target'
UPDATE kpi_results SET result_value = 1575.75, result_date = '2022-07-20' WHERE kpi_name = 'Profit Margin'
UPDATE KPIs SET revenue = 50000, expenses = 30000, profit = 20000 WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Employees SET salary = 60000 WHERE id = 5;
UPDATE KPIs SET profit = revenue - expenses WHERE id = 1
UPDATE Employees SET salary = salary * 1.1 WHERE department = 'Engineering'
